What you should remembe r is this. The Q's are onhogonal matrices-their 
colunms with (cos(J. sin (J) and (-sine, cos(J) are onhogonal unit vectors. Compu­
tations with the Q's are very stable. The angle (J can be chosen 10 make a panicular 
entry zero. Th is is a slep toward the final goal of a triangular matrix, That was the 
goal at the beginning of the book. arK! it still is. 
Problem Set 9.1
